newsitem.title: UK: UK's FTSE edges up, Berisford leads on bid hopes.
newsitem.headline: UK's FTSE edges up, Berisford leads on bid hopes.

text.p: The British stock market opened slightly higher on Friday with kitchen maker Berisford leading gainers, after the company said it received a possible takeover approach.
The FTSE 100 leading share index was up 5.5 points at 3,959.3 some 10 minutes after the start of official trade. Gainers outnumbered losers by almost three-to-one.

But business remained thin and dealers said the market was likely to drift back in line with weaker gilts as investors played safe ahead of next week's budget and fretted about the danger of British rate rises and the strong pound.
